tidbits.title: Island Nation
tidbits.description: The Marshall Islands is a collection of coral atolls and islands scattered across the Pacific Ocean, known for its stunning marine life.

tidbits.title: Nuclear Testing Legacy
tidbits.description: The country was affected by nuclear testing in the mid-20th century, and its history is intertwined with nuclear legacy and environmental concerns.

tidbits.title: Cultural Traditions
tidbits.description: Marshallese culture is rich in traditions, including navigation skills, stick charts, and storytelling, preserving their heritage.
